Key Arguments: The government should not censor information beyond what is currently legislated.
The government cannot be the arbiter of truth, as this is detrimental to democracy.
Censorship is associated with totalitarianism and fascism.
During COVID-19, the government allegedly falsified data and censored valid information.
Social media was a valuable source of information during COVID-19 despite government censorship.
Government and affiliated organizations compromised their integrity during COVID-19.
The proposed legislation would further push Australia towards totalitarianism.
Notable Quotes: The concept that the Government, or any other entity, is capable of being the arbiter of 'truth' is abhorrent to our fragile democracy.
Censorship is synonymous with totalitarianism and fascism.
During COVID, social media, in spite of the Australian Government's requirement that social media platforms undertake censorship on its behalf, was a valuable source of information and education.
The scale of the fraud that the Departments of Health around Australia undertook with no accountability is shocking and frightening.
